title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
content: As we all know, tomorrow may 27th, which is children's day. I want to make it a day of joy and happiness for the kids in my community.And I was thinking of spending just a few Bitcoin worth $60usd for some kids in my community so they will have a wonderful children's day celebration.   However I'm in need of some suggestions on how I  can make it truly fun and enjoyable for them. I want this day to be filled with laughter excitement and lasting memories. but don't really know what to do excalty.Do you have any suggestions for activities that I can organize for the kids, Perhaps a game that teaches them about Bitcoin while keeping them entertained? Or any other ideas that could make this day extra special for them? I'm open to any and all suggestions!

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: You could just buy them gifts, planning to host an event a day before the D-day may not be successful because Children’s day is a family holiday and I think the parents may have planned something for their kids already, or you could talk with your neighbors and organize a picnic. At the picnic, you could give a quick talk about bitcoin and have a quiz competition later to see who remembers anything you said.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PM Perhaps a game that teaches them about Bitcoin while keeping them entertained? no, pls, no teaching anything.let them enjoy one day when they don't have to learn anything.life's already very difficult for the kids.just buy them some candies or pizzas or something.it $60, not much u can do any way.

In $60, you can get lot of chocolates in my country. Another option, is sending them handmade cards with some images related to bitcoin along with chocolates.

I'm open to any and all suggestions!You should specify what’s the age range of the children you are targeting to celebrate with because teaching them is useless if they are on the age that they can’t comprehend complicated things. Much better if you will allocate the funds for the food and just give a toy with Bitcoin theme so that will play it most of the time that might retain in their memory until they grow to the age which they can understand Bitcoin.I already done feeding children under a care facility. Instead of the children, I educated those caregiver assign to the children so that they can educate the children once they grow old.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Simple gift giving with Bitcoin logos on it will certainly give them the impact. Also, prizes like a cake that has a Bitcoin logo on it and the same goes with Bitcoin pizza.No need to be the center of the party is all about Bitcoin. Let just those prizes and food that has Bitcoin logo on it and that's more than enough. Let it be just like a normal birthday kids party and they'll enjoy it for sure.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: What age range will the children be? I instantly had the idea to give them a quiz with a bitcoin related souvenir prize. If they are young enough maybe between 4-7 years old, you won't spend a lot of money buying them souvenirs they can see all day long like clothing accessories, keys, stickers or something else.

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PM  ✂️ I'm open to any and all suggestions!If you really want to bring joy to children on International Children's Day, do things that they enjoy and are appropriate for their age. Giving bitcoins or mentioning bitcoins on International Children's Day is really unnecessary and will most likely make the kids unhappy. If you want to teach them bitcoin, you can arrange another time as we have more time to spend with them than just this holiday. Do not destroy the happiness of the children just because of your wishes.

comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PMAs we all know, tomorrow may 27th, which is children's day. I want to make it a day of joy and happiness for the kids in my community.And I was thinking of spending just a few Bitcoin worth $60usd for some kids in my community so they will have a wonderful children's day celebration.It's something good to give back to your community through what bitcoin has helped you achieved in life, if you can remember those days you are also once a child and needs someone to help you celebrate the children anniversary in a grand style, so buying them gift and organizing a colorful event toark a memerial of this year's children's day celebration is very important, you can as well introduce bitcoin songs, objects and materials written with bitcoin inscription and many more.Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PMHowever I'm in need of some suggestions on how I  can make it truly fun and enjoyable for themMaking it more colour as you want may coat you a little but more higher funds, because you may need to rent them a DJ, cut cake, rent a hall, decorate the hall with bitcoin materials and get an MC to anchor the event, then you will have to feed them, buy drinks and also present them with a gift materials all with bitcoin logo inscribed on them.

comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PM  As we all know, tomorrow may 27th, which is children's day. Or any other ideas that could make this day extra special for them? I'm open to any and all suggestions!The idea is excellent, but finding practical proposals is a bit complicated, since you are looking for a unique idea for a group of children, not just one or two of your children. The children will be of different ages and from different cultural backgrounds, so the most that can be done is to organize a small celebration with the neighbors, where the children will have fun effortlessly getting to know complex ideas. Of course, $60 won't help you much in this case.There is a suggestion that you can think of, which is to introduce the Bitcoin to the parents during the celebration, who in turn will pass that knowledge on later to their children. Also you don't need those 60 bucks

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on May 26, 2023, 01:29:17 PM     However I'm in need of some suggestions on how I  can make it truly fun and enjoyable for them. I want this day to be filled with laughter excitement and lasting memories. but don't really know what to do excalty.Do you have any suggestions for activities that I can organize for the kids, Perhaps a game that teaches them about Bitcoin while keeping them entertained? Or any other ideas that could make this day extra special for them? I'm open to any and all suggestions!You said your budget for this is about $60 worth of bitcoin,?, why then Crack your brain on what to do?, just buy them some gifts, you could organize 60 children and buy each of them a $1 worth of gift, this can help you work within your budget..But then again, if you truly want to leave an maybe everlasting impression on their minds like you said, then be ready to spend far more than your current budget. - First, You will need to rent an open space - Throw a big party - Hire some children games and so on..Or to make things more understandable, you will need to take the children to a funfair event center where there are already several kinds of games children play, and you will also need to invite the parents of the children cus you alone can not control them all, you will need to make available food and drinks, and lastly, you wil still have to give the children tangible and memorable gift at the end of the day..This, if done in a small way might cost you up to, or more than $5000 dollars, so just simply buy gifts and share for the children in your community if you say your budget is just $60.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Op the occasion belong to you and whatever way you want it to be is okay. I don't think the community will have any suggestion on that. If we does then we are to also plan for your marriage. How the marriage is going to be if you have not married. And if you want the community to plan for you, the $60 is too small. Because something you would have done quietly has been brought to the public so the public will suggest that you should at least spend $100 for the children day party. And from your topic again, $60 can not make children day memorable because things are expenses. But if you must do, gather them and buy snags and give to them. Play music and let them dance and all these things you need money, you have to pay for the DJ as well.

Then you have to buy pizza because all kids love pizza  If you increase your money a little more, you can get what they want from the market in the remaining time. You should also advise them not to have too much sugar.

I want this day to be filled with laughter excitement and lasting memories. but don't really know what to do excalty.Do you have any suggestions for activities that I can organize for the kidsDepends on age of those kids, you will have to organize different things for them. Mindset of kids changes a lot just after 6 months or 1 to 2 years and if you have kids, you will recognize that. Change in mindset is part of their growth and you can not force a 6 years old kid to play a game for 4 years old kid, it's not funny and exciting at all.QuotePerhaps a game that teaches them about Bitcoin while keeping them entertained? Or any other ideas that could make this day extra special for them?Makes something funny for them and don't always think about Bitcoin because you are in Bitcointalk and your kids and friends have to play games about Bitcoin.Bitcoin Bubble Shooter https://www.mortgagecalculator.org/money-games/bitcoin-bubble-shooter/

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: Give them a gift they will never forget. I can't suggest the prizes because I don't know the kids in your community. But perhaps you can take him somewhere, celebrate there over food, and talk about Bitcoin there. So the point is to play while learning so they can start getting to know Bitcoin early on. You can come up with an interesting game, and it seems that you also need advice from the parents of each child, and I think they will help you.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: Since that would be there day, Youbneed to get them something that is going to make them happy of being recognized. Normally when I  was a kid, The Children's Day is a day that we normally go out especially to the stadium to watch matches and have fun. You can do similar things too since you have the intention. Although I would have advise you to get them clothes with the Bitcoin written on them but I think it's too late for you to do this. If the fund that you have would be enough you can organize a minimum party for them and get them snacks. I don't really know there numbers but I think this could make sense from my own angle.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.body: You could give them gifts or open up a kid party without mentioning the Bitcoin's name. Because some kids are not matured enough to absorb those knowledge even the basics about Bitcoin and for sure they would just focus on enjoying like some games. But if they are matured enough like 10+ maybe a little quiz games with a prizes as a reward whenever they answer a questions about BTC. Of course you would introduce the basics like the definition of BTC in simple way a presentation with more on visualization since kids are more into photographic memory. Then you could simply start the game and let them enjoy. If you still have the budget you could just print some Bitcoin logo like keychain for them to remember the event.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: No matter how talking about bitcoin may sound good to the children on Children's day, you need to know that talking to children about bitcoins only on that day will not really make any difference. Giving gifts to children is something every child will want, especially those that have never experienced love. You can give them both gifts that they can enjoy like candies etc and also add an educational material that they can keep, something about bitcoins, you have to think creatively. It will require finance, that is something you should know, so you can either seek support, or do what is within your power.

comments.author: bayudndy
comments.body: It seems like a good idea to have a big party and give the kids gifts with bitcoins, but to me, giving the kids $60 in bitcoins doesn't really seem right for the kids because it may not be suitable for all children of different ages and they may also be ignorant of bitcoin. So instead of giving such gifts, you can make a party with bitcoin decorations. Make bitcoin-related treats and host bitcoin-themed games with rewards like bitcoin logo clothing. This will leave a stronger impression than giving a gift of cash.
